comments.body: This is my favorite part, it's very easy now to set up more services and clients as we keep adding more integrations.
We had recently discussion about the "alice/bob" characters and having to introduce more "neutral" names. But it's good for now

Hmmm @mik-laj this is failing for me on self-hosted runners with the message:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/runs/1831096008?check_suite_focus=true#step:6:3864
```
  Creating Kerberos network
  ./scripts/ci/testing/ci_run_airflow_testing.sh: line 58: kerberos::create_kerberos_network: command not found
  The Compose file '/home/runner/actions-runner/_work/airflow/airflow/scripts/ci/docker-compose/integration-kerberos.yml' is invalid because:
  networks.example.com value Additional properties are not allowed ('attachable' was unexpected)
```

Any ideas? Is it a particular version of docker compose or docker?
It looks like attachable was only added in v3.1 of the compose spec, but we are on 2.2

What version of docker-compose do we have installed?  Docker Compose 1.28.2 is preinstalled on the hosted runner. https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/blob/main/images/linux/Ubuntu2004-README.md
(I'm not sure we need the attachable flag though -- it seems to be the default.) Still, will update ver of compose.
https://docs.docker.com/compose/compose-file/compose-file-v2/ only mentions attachable once, but not as a field.

I also do not know if we need this flag. I checked the network configuration that is created by docker-compose using the ``docker inspect example.com`` command and entered the identical configuration in the `docker-compose.yaml` file. Kerberos is very sensitive to changes in the network, so I didn't want to break anything. To check the available options in the specification, I chose these specifications in the IDE. Now I can press CTRL + field and see the full specs.

The only published compose spec I was able to find was for v3/latest -- so that might be what that is using.

Well, lets see what my PR that removes it does to the tests.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +82,86 @@    name: example.com
    driver: bridge
    attachable: true
    ipam:
      config:
